psalm.text:
[[Ps 19,2]]The heavens declare the glory of God; 
and the firmament proclaims his handiwork.
[[Ps 19,3]]Day pours out the word to day, 
and night to night imparts knowledge.

[[Ps 19,4]]Not a word nor a discourse 
whose voice is not heard;
[[Ps 19,5]]Through all the earth their voice resounds, 
and to the ends of the world, their message.
psalm.title: Psalms

gospel.text:
[[Mt 9,9]]As Jesus passed by, he saw a man named Matthew sitting at the customs post. He said to him, "Follow me." And he got up and followed him.
[[Mt 9,10]]While he was at table in his house, many tax collectors and sinners came and sat with Jesus and his disciples.
[[Mt 9,11]]The Pharisees saw this and said to his disciples, "Why does your teacher eat with tax collectors and sinners?"
[[Mt 9,12]]He heard this and said, "Those who are well do not need a physician, but the sick do.
[[Mt 9,13]]Go and learn the meaning of the words, 'I desire mercy, not sacrifice.' I did not come to call the righteous but sinners."
gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Matthew

first_reading.text:
[[Ep 4,1]]Brothers and sisters : I, a prisoner for the Lord, urge you to live in a manner worthy of the call you have received,
[[Ep 4,2]]with all humility and gentleness, with patience, bearing with one another through love,
[[Ep 4,3]]striving to preserve the unity of the spirit through the bond of peace:
[[Ep 4,4]]one body and one Spirit, as you were also called to the one hope of your call;
[[Ep 4,5]]one Lord, one faith, one baptism;
[[Ep 4,6]]one God and Father of all, who is over all and through all and in all.
[[Ep 4,7]]But grace was given to each of us according to the measure of Christ's gift.
[[Ep 4,11]]And he gave some as apostles, others as prophets, others as evangelists, others as pastors and teachers,
[[Ep 4,12]]to equip the holy ones for the work of ministry, for building up the body of Christ,
[[Ep 4,13]]until we all attain to the unity of faith and knowledge of the Son of God, to mature manhood, to the extent of the full stature of Christ,
first_reading.title: Letter to the Ephesians
